definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: So crowded is this bus that I can hardly breathe.
sentences.chinese: 車上如此擁擠以至於我幾乎喘不動氣。

sentences.english: Never lose your temper in the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 在法庭上千萬不要動氣。

sentences.english: If that's the case, I am not surprised he was angry.
sentences.chinese: 假如是那樣的，他動氣就不敷爲奇了。

sentences.english: I hope you will not take any offense at my words.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要因我的話而動氣。

sentences.english: Really good friends don't take offence.
sentences.chinese: 非常好的朋友不會動氣。

definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to harm others/to mock people/to taunt/humiliating
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
